channel.title: Content Mix for Video News Bites

item.title: L.A. Galaxy Wins MLS Cup
item.description: American soccer star Landon Donovan's grand finale in professional soccer ended on a high note as the L.A. Galaxy defeated the New England Revolution to win the MLS Cup! Although it was L.A. who scored the first goal, Revolution star Chris Tierney sent the game into extra time with a 79th-minute, game-tying goal. Galaxy's Robbie Keane became the man of the evening however after scoring the winning goal with 9 minutes left in extra time.

item.title: La Paz Named New7Wonders City
item.description: The Bolivian city of La Paz has just been named one of the New7Wonders cities of the world! A campaign to name the 7 "greatest" cities around the globe has been in the works for years with filmmaker Bernard Weber leading the search. Citizens of La Paz are excited, proud, and already celebrating their wonderful city. Mayor Luis Revilla is also excited for all the opportunity the title of "wonder city" will bring! Tourism is expected to boom in all newly named Wonder cities.

item.title: 12 Days of Harry Potter
item.description: J.K. Rowling is celebrating her "12 days of Christmas" by sharing more stories of the infamous Harry Potter! The extremely successful storyteller will release 12 new short stories about everyone's favorite wizard beginning December 12th and ending on Christmas Eve. She says her stories will focus on the wizarding world and teases one particular story on Potter's nemesis Draco Malfoy. All stories will be released online on the Pottermore website!

item.title: Peyton's 51-Game Passing Streak Snapped
item.description: Peyton Manning's 51-game touchdown pass streak has officially ended. The four-year long streak was snapped on Sunday as the Broncos defeated the Buffalo Bills 24-17 in Denver. The superstar was 4 games away from breaking Drew Brees' record of 54 games with a touchdown pass. Sunday's game marks yet another game under 200 yards for Manning, but fans shouldn't get too upset. His numbers are down to the emergence of phenom running back C.J. Anderson.

item.title: 2,500 Santas In Sydney
item.description: 2,500 runners, each dressed from head to toe as Santa Claus, raced through Sydney this weekend for a fun and somewhat competitive charity run. The festive race took the Santas from Darling Harbour to the Sydney Opera House for roughly 3 miles of walking, jogging, skipping, and dancing. The Santa fun run partnered with children's non-profit Variety to raise money for their organization. The charity works to empower sick, disabled, and disadvantaged youth.

item.title: Sam Smith, Pharrell, and BeyoncÃ© Lead Grammy Nominations
item.description: Perhaps to no one's surprise Sam Smith, Pharrell Williams, and BeyoncÃ© all lead the 2015 Grammy nominations with 6 each! All but one of the nominations were announced early Friday morning. Sam Smith's big categories included Record of the Year and Song of the Year for "Stay With Me." His debut album "In The Lonely Hour" joins BeyoncÃ©'s self-titled album, Pharrell's "Girl," as well as Ed Sheeran's "x" and Beck's "Morning Phase."
